comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The top photo is a ripper - full of interesting stuff. First the photographer "P. C. BADIER NEWTOWN NSW" - Philip C. Badier, 98 King Street, Newtown. Studio operated between 1887-8 - handle.slv.vic.gov.au/10381/45923 . According to Trove he was a keen cyclist too. The ferries - BUNYA BUNYA or WARATAH ??

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Interesting to compare with this contemporary Henry King photo - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362662569/] Megazoom at PhM - from.ph/30871

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And compare with the wonderful 1890 (a few years later) painting by Arthur Streeton - From McMahon's Point - fare one penny (NGA). Now on the excellent GoogleArtProject - zoom right in to see every brushstroke detail, and click on the little man to see the painting at the NGA - www.googleartproject.com/collection/national-gallery-of-a...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Its great isn't it? Thanks for the details & compatible pics. PS CAMMERAY was another suggestion thrown our way re the paddlesteamer ferry. I love that Streeton painting, its so evocative! A bit of beauty in the day. I wonder if this article reference is to the same photographer? Can't have been too many Badiers with a camera. Its 1891 & mentions a studio in Oxford street.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: One digitised newspaper hit suggests photographer Phillip Charles Badier might have left his Newtown address by ca. May 1887...he appears to have became insolvent in ca. March 1887...and was at Oxford St Paddington by 1888...per NSW BDMs he appears to have died in 1898 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article18899631 re his insolvency nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13656509 Personal notice column 5...'Will P.C. Badier, late of 98 King-street, Newtown, oblige by sending photos or address to Miss L.J. Aldred, Fairmount, Summer Hill'

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: 1896 - Phillip Charles Badier, photographer, aged 24 (misprint?? - unless he took these photos when he was 14) fell off a horse near Bathurst and fractured his spine - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/63940530
